title: Somalis Are Going Hungry. Their Government Isn’t Calling It a Famine.
description: Humanitarian groups say Somalia’s leaders are resisting a formal declaration of famine that could unlock aid and save lives.
dc:creator: Abdi Latif Dahir
media:credit: Andrea Bruce for The New York Times
media:description: In Baidoa, Somalia, an area gripped by hunger, Rahma Ali Ibrahim held her malnourished 1-year-old son, Zakaria Bashir, while they waited for medicine at the Horseed Health Center on Thursday.
